intro: Navarretia densifolia var. jacumbana, commonly known as the jacumban flax. This variety is native to California and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. It features slender, branching stems covered in dense, linear leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers during the spring, which are clustered in racemes. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions with well-drained conditions.
